channel.title: Photography contest
channel.description:
So the General Discussion section isn't getting much publicity at the moment. There isn't much new topics being brought up. So seeing as some people here are interested in the photography arts, I was wondering that maybe a few members including myself can hold a photography contest. Somewhat similar to the old modelling contest.
[u]The winners reward?[/u] Well I do not think that any staff member would approve some sort of badge because it is completely irrelevant to this website. We're open to suggestions I guess. Maybe the satisfaction of a virtual handshake from the judges?
[u]What will we be assessed on?[/u] You will be mainly marked on the theme, techniques and editing skills. By techniques I mean the use of depth of field, rule of thirds, lines, framing, focus, contrast etc.
[u]How will this work?[/u] You will signup using the information provided below. You will then be given a week to take raw photos with no editing, submit them before or on the due date. You will then be given 3 days to edit the images. Hint hint, I think surrealism would be the best approach to get the judges attention, though, if you do not already know what this is then don't bother.
[b]Signup Exemplar:[/b]
[ul][li][b]Your name is:[/b] Mason McLeod[/li] [li][b]The theme I will pick is:[/b] Time Travel[/li] [li][b]Experience with photography:[/b] Student[/li] [li][b]Camera:[/b] Cannon EOS 1100D[/li][/ul]
[b]Signup Template:[/b] [code] [b]Signup Form:[/b]
[ul][li][b]Your name is:[/b] INERT HERE[/li] [li][b]The theme I will pick is:[/b] INSERT HERE[/li] [li][b]Experience with photography:[/b] INSERT HERE[/li] [li][b]Camera:[/b] INSERT HERE[/li][/ul]
[/code]
Reason why I posted this here first is to gather an idea of how much people would participate. That and to hopefully gather a few suggestions.
[hr]
A bit of work I have done myself. [img width=500]http://sphotos-f.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash4/1149350_566845470019077_1047076986_o.jpg[/img][img width=500]http://sphotos-a.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-frc1/793774_566845070019117_279815088_o.jpg[/img] [img width=500]http://sphotos-b.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-frc1/1167464_566844783352479_1744089406_o.jpg[/img][img width=500]http://sphotos-a.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-prn2/964253_566840383352919_899100187_o.jpg[/img] Unfortunately my best work was left at school. I should see about getting em back.

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

That’s a good point casey. I’m looking for another judge or two, message me if you’re interested.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @nickypie nickypie
item.description:
@nickypie wrote:

yeah compitions bring out the worst in people (but also the best)

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:10, topic:536067”]Reason being why I left this topic unattended for a bit was to allow people to see it before I actually start the comp. So far it looks like we’re going to have 6 participants. I don’t think I should be the only judge so the numbers in participants may decrease, so maybe 2 or 3 judges? I’d like to start this competition on a Monday. The time between now and Monday is to plan and prepare your theme, props, ideas, models, techniques etc.

Do you think I should make the topic now for sign ups?[/quote]
perhaps a “community event” rather than a competition would be more fitting for the first for events

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @nickypie nickypie
item.description:
@nickypie wrote:

w8 for christmas so i get a DSLR instead of my LEICA V LUX 30 LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Reason being why I left this topic unattended for a bit was to allow people to see it before I actually start the comp. So far it looks like we’re going to have 6 participants. I don’t think I should be the only judge so the numbers in participants may decrease, so maybe 2 or 3 judges? I’d like to start this competition on a Monday. The time between now and Monday is to plan and prepare your theme, props, ideas, models, techniques etc.

Do you think I should make the topic now for sign ups?

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @nickypie nickypie
item.description:
@nickypie wrote:

you need to take in consideration if editing of images is allowed, not everybody knows how to use lightroom/photoshop, so it would be unfair. Id like to see this though, hoping to get a new DSLR for christmas.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Like most contests, there is no downside. The issue comes with getting people to actually participate, I’m sure there are people out there but there is just no motivation to try. This topic is growing old now, if you’re still trying this then good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

There’s no downfall to it whatsoever, thumbs up.

Read full topic

I’d participate if this was to happen. Good idea.

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Iphone is fine. I cant say a name but there is a successful photographer who works on most of her projects using an Iphone. Her results get her over $1000 per shoot.

Read full topic

item.title: Photography contest
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I think it’d be a cool idea, but should be judged more on creativity than quality you know? For example, I don’t have a proper camera other than my gopro and iphone.

Read full topic
